alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 5:20PM EST until February 05 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Monongahela River Near Charleroi affecting Washington, Fayette and Westmoreland Counties. Monongahela River Near Elizabeth affecting Allegheny, Washington and Westmoreland Counties.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC051-125-129-051200- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.W.0003.220204T2252Z-220205T1200Z/ /CHRP1.1.ER.220204T2252Z.220205T0000Z.220205T0600Z.NO/ 520 PM EST Fri Feb 4 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Monongahela River near Charleroi. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Route 201 in closed due to flooding along Donner`s Run. At 26.3 feet, Water reaches the level reached during Hurricane Ivan September 18, 2004. At 28.0 feet, In Monongahela, backwater flooding along Pigeon Creek begins from the intersection of Park Way and Park Avenue. At 29.0 feet, Navigation suspended, lock out of service. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 27.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 28.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
